definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Humidity, and all kinds of liquids or moisture will erode electronic wires.
sentences.chinese: 湿气和各种液体或水分都会腐蚀电子线路。

sentences.english: When it rains, a traditional compressor kicks in to cut moisture.
sentences.chinese: 到下雨时，一台普通的压缩机就足以降低湿气。

sentences.english: For instance, radiation and moisture don’t mix.
sentences.chinese: 例如，不要把辐射和湿气混淆起来。

sentences.english: eg：The rubber seal is designed to keep out all the moisture.
sentences.chinese: 橡胶的密封垫是用以隔绝湿气的。

sentences.english: That night the moisture was heavy.
For example, children could rinse out their wet nightclothes .
sentences.chinese: 上面举例来说，孩子可以清洗外面的他们湿气睡衣。

sentences.english: I chose one that was still wet from the morning dew with traces of dirt and sand on its skin.
sentences.chinese: 我挑了一个，上面还带有朝露的湿气并沾着点沙土。

sentences.english: It can respond quickly to moisture-proofing and de-moisturization of SMD between semiconductor production processes.
sentences.chinese: 能迅速反应在半导体制程中的湿气，水气及除湿状况。

sentences.english: The moisture in the air makes insects' wings heavy.
sentences.chinese: 空气里的湿气使得昆虫的翅膀很重。

sentences.english: The condensation shorts the circuits to your brain, and you get all woozy.
sentences.chinese: 湿气凝结导致大脑短路，你开始头昏脑胀。

sentences.english: Because of grave-damps falling round my head?
sentences.chinese: 因坟头湿气降临我头颅。

sentences.english: The room is bone-dry , not a trace of damp anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 房间十分干燥，连一点湿气也没有。

sentences.english: Reduce the likelihood of blisters caused by moist air saturation of the hull.
sentences.chinese: 减少由湿气浸入船壳而所引起气泡的可能性。

sentences.english: Home if there is pregnant or rheumatism patients, the more vulnerable to moisture violations.
sentences.chinese: 家里如果有孕妇或风湿病患者，更容易受到湿气侵害。

sentences.english: The combination of heat and moisture, along with the right wind conditions, can create a new hurricane.
sentences.chinese: 炎热和湿气一起，再加上适当的风，便形成一场飓风。

definition: spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
